definitions.definition: to go past something or someone or move in relation to it, him, or her:
examples: I passed him on the stairs this morning.

definitions.definition: to go past a particular point in time:
examples: Don't buy goods that have passed their sell-by date.

definitions.definition: to go past something by being greater in amount or degree:
examples: The company's turnover is expected to pass the $10 million mark by the end of this year.

definitions.definition: If you say a state or feeling will pass, you mean it will disappear:
examples: Don't worry, his depression is only temporary - it'll soon pass.

definitions.definition: a successful result in an exam:
examples: Jon Hill achieved two grade A passes at A-level.

definitions.definition: a successful result in a course or exam for which the student will not be given a mark:
examples: I got a pass in my Literature course.
